Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine is a singleplayer third-person action, TPS and shooter game in the Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine and Warhammer 40,000 series.

General information

Lexicanum - A huge wiki for the Warhammer 40,000 series
GOG.com Community Discussions
GOG.com Support Page
Steam Community Discussions

Availability[edit]

Source DRM Notes Keys OS

Anniversary Edition.
GOG.com
Singleplayer-only release, therefore omits DLC.

Anniversary Edition.

Anniversary Edition.
Amazon.com (unavailable)
(unavailable)
Humble Store (unavailable)
Anniversary Edition.
On September 23, 2021, the game was relaunched as the Anniversary Edition which includes all DLC (like the prior Space Marine Collection) and a few extras (manuals, soundtrack, strategy guide, etc.), with all previous owners being upgraded to that version.
All non-GOG versions require Steam DRM

Issues unresolved[edit]

Stuttering[edit]

The game stutters randomly in cutscenes, credits, shooting, walking, etc. This occurs with and without v-sync.[6] [7]

Audio stuttering[edit]

No permanent fix. Some temporary fixes include disabling v-sync and installing the game on a faster disk drive.

Game crash on startup[edit]

Usethis Dll.
Set SpaceMarine.exe to run in Windows 7 Compatibility mode[citation needed]
Verify game cache integrity on Steam.
No permanent fix.
Set number of processors to 8
  1. On Windows desktop click Start and in the search bar type msconfig.
  2. Click on the Boot tab and click Advanced options...
  3. Check Number of processors and in the drop down menu select 8.
  4. Click OK and restart your computer for changes to take effect.

Notes

After you stop playing the game, uncheck Number of processors and restart your computer to revert back to original settings.
Set Windows to automatically limit the game to eight CPU cores (Windows 10 and 11)
  1. Download the Windows ADK.
  2. During installation, it gives the option to select multiple tools; the only one needed is Compatibility Administrator.
  3. Once installed, open the Start Menu folder named Windows Kits, and launch Compatiblity Administrator (32-bit).
  4. Select the new database under custom databases.
  5. Click the database menu > Create New > Application Fix.
  6. Provide the full path of SpaceMarine.exe and give it a name of choosing.
  7. Skip past the compatibility mode options.
  8. In compatibility fixes select ProcessorCountLieForHybridCPU.
  9. With ProcessorCountLieForHybridCPU selected click parameters and put 8 into the command line field then click ok.
  10. Save the database from the Database menu and give it a name when prompted.
  11. Select File > Install. Now the fix will automatically be applied whenever the game is launched.

Game hangs at black screen when loading on Windows 10[edit]

Set SpaceMarine.exe to run as administrator[citation needed]

Issues fixed[edit]

BIOS fix[edit]

When using an old BIOS with the AMD FX Series of CPU's game is unplayable.
Update BIOS[citation needed]

Game crashes after completing the Valkyrie air transport mission and landing on the bridge[edit]

Turn Vsync on[citation needed]
Can only turn Vsync on or off outside of gameplay, when launching the game.
Temporarily reduce all graphics settings to Low and set the resolution to the lowest possible[citation needed]
Limit the game to using only one or two CPU cores[citation needed]

Launch the game and then launch Windows Task Manager by pressing `Ctrl+Shift+Esc`. Find `spacemarine.exe`, right-click it, and choose `Set Affinity`. Select only the first two cores of your CPU and click OK.

Game runs at low fps on Windows 10/11[edit]

Whitelist the SpaceMarine.exe and the folder in "Malwarebytes" or other "security software" and enable Vsync in game.

Game crashes shortly after launching[edit]

Game is incompatible with multicore CPUs
Limit the number of cores in your CPU[8]

Game stutters with keyboard input[edit]

The game stutters while reading inputs from keyboard, this is really noticeable for continuous presses. Occurs if you're using Japanese keyboard layout in Windows.
Revert to a previous version of an IME[9]

Notes

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Notes regarding Steam Play (Linux) data:
    • File/folder structure within this directory reflects the path(s) listed for Windows and/or Steam game data.
    • Games with Steam Cloud support may also store data in ~/.steam/steam/userdata/<user-id>/55150/.
    • Use Wine's registry editor to access any Windows registry paths.
    • The app ID (55150) may differ in some cases.
    • Treat backslashes as forward slashes.
    • See the glossary page for details on Windows data paths.

    Tested on Steam version (overlay disabled) W10 22H2 (19045.3086) 60 FPS Cap 120hz with NCP no v-sync. I also tried Adaptive v-sync with NCP and compatibility mode W7 with no success to fix it.
